It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, ephemeral blooms that appear in late spring. The plant has small, white, star-shaped flowers that are often hidden among the sand, making it difficult to spot. Schizoglossum carsonii is adapted to arid environments, with a shallow root system and a short growing season.
